intro: Schizolepis paranensis, commonly known as the Parana schizolepis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
